ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Social Welfare and Rural Development Society(Ghatal) i.e. SWRDS is a non-political, non-profitable and non-religious registered voluntary social welfare and rural development organisation fully devoted to the upliftment of the rural poor backward and illiterate pepole of Ghatal Sub-Division under West Medinipur district of West Bengal since the inception of the society in the year 1985. Later the organisation was register under Registrar of Societies of Govt. of W.B. bearing no. S-58581 of 1988-89. The society also registred under FCRA bearing No. 147040162 of Dt. 05.06.91. The society also Reg. under Income tax Act. exemption U-S 80G & 35AC. The following activities of the organisation deserve special attention. 1. Maintaining an Old Age Home under the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment since 1993-94. 2. Maintaining a Day-Care Centre for (50 aged people serving Mid-Day-Meal) under the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment since 1993-94. 3. Maintaining 6 Creche Centre under Rajib Gandhi National Creche Programe under Central Social Welfare Board, New Delhi since 2004-05. 4. Maintaining Charitable Dispensary Unit of Homiopathy and Allopathy treatment with organisation own fund from the inception of the society in 1985.0 5. Maintaining a Drug De-addiction centre under the Ministry of Health & Family welfare for the tretment of the drug addicts and alchoholic patient for this decided to setup a 15 bedded Treatment-cum-rehabilitation centre at Ghatal town in the district of West Medinipur. Considering the need of the project the monitoring committee has already recomended the project in year 2007-08 but no grant was released though the project has alredy been recomended by the West Bengal Govt. in 2007-08 and 2008-09 and assumed to be recomended for the year 2009-10. 6. Maintaining Ambulance service (two ambulances) under Indo-Germen Basic Health Project of Govt. of West Bengal. 7. Maintaining Self-Help Groups with the financial Assistance from Rashtriya Mahila Kosh, New Delhi and from West Bengal Minority Development Finance Corporation, Kolkata. 8. Vocational Training Programes are being conducted (Handloom weaving, Jute Handicrafts, Wool knitting under CAPART & NORAD Assistance Programe) to help the poor wemen in their ecomic self sufficiency. 9. Maintaining a Nursery-cum-Pry School with the assistance from NEG under IGSSS, New Delhi. 10. Training Programes are being taken to help the unemployed youths in their enter preneurship development skill under the MSME, New Delhi. 11. Maintaining a Working Womens Hostel, started with CSWB, New Delhi and now with own fund. 12. Orginising an Innovative Scheme to prevent the trend of prostitution among poor, backward, illiterate women of the surrounding areas of Ghatal Town as because Ghatal town is a red-light area and also a highly AIDS - prone area through formal education to girls students of aged 12 to 18 years. The scheme was previously sanctined from CSWB, New Delhi for the 2004-05 but no financial grant has yet been sanctioned till 2008-09 though comunications were continued till date. The total finacial requirement is maintained from the own fund of the society.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: About Society for Applied Studies It is a non-government research and training center in the not for profit domain. The center was registered in 1990 and started functioning in 1995 initially through its head quarter in Kolkata and now also through the Regional Center at Delhi. It is recognized by the Ministry of Science and Technology as a Scientific and Industrial Research Organization (SIRO).The overall strategy of the center is to identify important research questions, interventions, or technologies and then implement the research findings through partnership, networking with public and non-government institutions. The achievements of the center over the years are highlighted below: â€¢Demonstrated the beneficial effect of zinc as adjunct treatment of pneumonia in infants. â€¢Demonstrated the role of sick newborn units at district hospitals and peripheral health outfits in reducing NMR & IMR, as an alternative complimentary approach. Now known as Purulia Model of sick newborn care, it is being replicated in several states in India and in Bangladesh and Nepal. In a recent book, â€œGood Practices Resource Bookâ€ published by Planning Commission and UNDP India, Purulia Model is described in a chapter entitled, â€œHub and Spoke, Approach for Strengthening Facilities for Neonatal Careâ€ 2009; pp:37-41. â€¢Developed a killed oral Shigella vaccine that showed very high protection in disease models of shigellosis in animals â€¢Demonstrated the role of H. pylori infection in anemia in children and its adverse effect on response to treatment with iron â€¢Developed new equations for calculating body fat and fat free mass based on skin-fold thickness and mid-arm circumference in preschool children for field use. â€¢Became a partner in the development of a live oral cholera vaccine supported by the Ministry of Science and Technology, Govt. of India â€¢Demonstrated the role of indoor air pollution from polluting cooking fuels as a risk factor for pneumonia in infants and children. â€¢Established a disease model of shigellosis in rabbits for its usefulness in vaccine protection studies â€¢Established an innovative human volunteer study set up for testing enteric vaccines at the Infectious Diseases Hospital, Kolkata â€¢Demonstrated the adverse effect of antimicrobial treatment of putative reproductive tract infection of pregnant women on the mothers and babies. â€¢Showed that Folic Acid protects against enteric bacterial translocation in an animal model. â€¢Created an organization named â€˜SPARSHAâ€™ run by people with HIV/AIDS and their friends. â€¢Established a new model of human resources for Sick Newborn Care at fixed facilities named â€œNewborn Aidesâ€. â€¢The centre over the year has published 83 research papers largely in peer reviewed international journals. â€¢The center has trained 5 students for Ph.D degree; two completed under a collaborating Scientist at NICED and two directly from the Center; one is now completing the Ph.D. thesis. Three of them are now doing Post Doctoral Fellowship in US Universities â€¢The Centre trained a large number of doctors on â€œComputerized Data Management & Statistical Analysisâ€ using a computer program EPI Info, developed by WHO (Geneva) and CDC Atlanta (USA).

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: It(SABAI) is a no-governmental initiative working to improve the conditions of life and livelihood of the needy-mainly in the predominantly rural and economically weak people in different districts of West Bengal.Problems which plague our Society at large,mainly lack ofEducation,poverty,Unemployment,lac of Awareness regarding Health were the impetus behind the formation of the NGO. SABAI-the Bengali word meaning" ALL" is presently engaged in different educational,health and income generation programme(with special emphasis on self-employment). Working independently and collectively-the organization aspires to supplement and complement the Government efforts in these areas. To build Awareness amongst the rural or semi urban youth regarding the present day socio-economic scenario,nature of employment,technological advancements and health Care, to equip the youth to face this changing scenario by impating various training to them and helping them to build career of their own,to provide Health Care Awareness,services and Basic Healthcare Amenities to the people at a minimum affordable cost a Vocational Training Centre namely Jyotirmoy Basu Voccational Training Centre(JBVTC) and a health wing namely Bishnupur Clinical And Diagnostic Centre (BCDC) have been set up. JBVTC has been set up to run the STVT and Diploma courses under the Technical Education & Training Department,Govt.of West Bengal.Students from the conventional courses are getting trained in income generating activities at a very nominal cost. The students who have passed out have already found their way to earn in employment or in self-employment. Vocational Schooling has also been started in this Institute. BCDC has been set up and it is participating in RSK/RSBY Projects of NHM in 8 Hospitals in the District of South 24 Parganas,North 24 Parganas and Kolkata in West Bengal.Also doing Public Private Partnership(PPP) Scheme of the State Govt. and providing Diagnostic Services to the Patients in 5 Hospitals in South 24 Parganas District at present. More over,the Centre participated in MCTC Programme under RNTCP Scheme for Tuberculosis Patients in the district of South 24 Parganas.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Society for Equitable Voluntary Actions SEVA) is a development organisation working in the two districts of West Bengal â€“ North 24 Parganas and Birbhum since last 29 years. The Project at North 24 Parganas is known as Vikas Kendra. We are working with population of 35/40 villages (Religious Minority Dense) of Baduria, Habra-1 & II & Deganga CD Blocks. Where we have been there for last 24 years. The other project known as Manab Jamin is in Birbhum for the last 15 years. Our main area of work spans is Child Development, WASH, Health, Education & Organic Farm and Non Farm Micro Enterprises, Training and Capacity Building of Women, Youth and PWDs. We also run a Short Stay Home for destitute and rescued women, a small old age home and an Orphanage. The entire complex is known as Ananda Kendra takes care of 60 heads. We also run 24 hours Womenâ€™s Helpline for counseling the women in distress. Our Food Process Unit provides employment to the rural women and supplies various indigenous products. We also have tie up with Industrial Jute Units to provide Raw Jute Fiber for manufacturing. We engage 700 jute farmers in the Organic Jute Culture. This farming nature increases the quality of Raw Jute which is viable business option for Sick Jute Industry. In this process the direct jute farmers get the economical benefit as well the labourers will get employment benefit from the Jute Industry. We are also running Medicinal Plantation Units for different diversified products of Medicinal plant in sustainable way. For education growth of SC, ST and Minorities we are running pre-primary school to grow school going habit for new generation learners. In MJ there are 8 centres in 8 villages. Each village centres (MJSK) capacity 30 children with 2 teachers (1 Asst. Teacher & 1 Mother Teacher). The age group of children is 3 â€“ 5 years. Methodology of teaching normally it is a play method using lot of TLM, charts, posters, flash cards, magic bag etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: HIV Prevalence fluctuates around 5% as has been found in the various Sentinel Surveillance which shows that it has not increased compared to the last Point Prevalence and has remained stagnant for the last few years.The usage of condom by Babus has increased to about 65% with the full fledged working of the sathi Sangathan, an organisation of the Babus.Referral to various Govt. ICTC and to Mamata Care and Treatment Centre(community based ICTC centre of DMSC),DOTs Centre has also increased. Sex workers are also referred to other NGO FOR treatment of general ailments.Monitoring formats have been prepared which could result in giving a clearer insight into the CMIS records.Almost each of the target community members has been contacted twice every month. Sextual health counselling has been catered to almost all target community members.Number of clinics actually held are over 90 percent. Various IEC materials,like CDs, books and flip charts, water bottles, have been developed and distrbuted as per the demand of target community and other stakeholders.Number of condoms sold have increased through peer educators and non-traditional outlets and also incrased the number of female condoms used.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We have been able to organize the underprivileged communities of the rural areas of W.B., Jharkhand and Orissa in a systematic & planned way for alternative sustainable development of their own locale in a participatory process. (We have formed 9 well-structured POs, formation of nine other POs is in progress) We have capacitated them for conservation, preservation and sustainable utilization of local natural resources based on their proficiency, knowledge and experience Women are taking decision both in their family and social matter. Along with economic amelioration, collective leadership, analytical skill, problem solving ability, cooperative attitude and decision making power have been developed among the womenâ€™s groups. We have been able to encourage the rural marginalized communities to speak out for their Rights & Entitlements, which are being threatened and eroded due to unrestrained market economy We have been able to motivate numerous development organizations to engage the anti-globalization struggle being waged by the people in different regions of western Orissa and east Jharkhand. Our endeavor for the sustainable agriculture to preserve food security, has been able to revive several ancestral seeds and varieties of rice and vegetables (such as baskathi, khayrashol, moulata, govirponkoj, sabita, morichshal) Farming communities, who were previously dependant on chemical fertilizers and pesticides have started using organic manures, which has been promoted by our organizers About 459 families have excavated pond in their land and are getting the benefit of both fish cultivation and kitchen garden in the adjoining areas. 10-20 % migration could be checked as a result of ensured livelihood option. In the gram sansad meetings the members of POs are raising their voice for different development action in the vicinity The villagers are now fighting against social evils that are directly linked with social unrest due to inequality & lack of education. They have led movements against illicit country liquor den, dowry and bride torture, wife beating by drunk husbands. Our intervention has reduced women and child trafficking by 30% in our working area close to the international border facing Bangladesh. About 35 adolescent girls, who were trafficked, have been rehabilitated Local traditional myths and beliefs regarding health & hygiene are being obliterated to a great extent. 5 homeopathy clinics are running successfully and, on an average 4300 villagers are being treated annually 68 Non-formal education centers including one residential school function successfully, where about 2030 learners were benefited every year. 2256 Self Help Groups (SHGs) have been formed, the members of which are mainly women. Rural people are becoming conscious about the water as a right rather than services We have extended our support to 42 grassroots and medium level development organizations to spread the idea of alternative development process. They are now taking follow-up actions in their respective areas. 414 VOs/ NGOs/ Networks have been capacitated to make their efforts more congruent to the contextual need and to make them more competent for addressing the issues

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Society for Universal Welfare and Progress is a philanthropic institution being engaged with multifaceted community developmental activities in various paradigms of social service sectors at the grass roots level. As far as its activities are concerned, the organization is conducting a Family Counselling Centre at Siliguri Special Correctional Home, in West Bengal. The programme is a sponsored project of Central Social Welfare Board, New Delhi. Besides the above, the organization is also actively involved in mother, child care, immunization, literacy expansion programmes. In addition, amongst all other activities, mentionable are: women liberation movements, SHG activities with micro-credit movements, L.I.C.I. Micro insurance social security activities, community capacity building training, agriculture through organic mode, community sensitization, Research and developmental programmes and Value form cultural and sporting events.

This single remedy in homoeopathy employed in the treatment of MB leprosy has been proved effective.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: St. John Ambulance Association, Uttar Dinajpur District Centre is governed, managed and controlled by the Executive Committee consisting of 13 Members. The organization also has been registered with Person with disability. Government of India has chosen the organization as MNGO for Uttar Dinajpur District in the field of Reproductive and Child Health. St. John Ambulance Association is working in the area on Community bases ASHA (NRHM) Programme. Besides these activities St. John Ambulance Association works on ICDS Workers Training Centre since 1984. The organization also promotes Self Help Group (SHGs) and conducts many NGO training on SHG promotion with the help of NABARD. The organization is implementing Anti Human Trafficking specially case management with the help of Groupe Developpment. Protection and prevention of vulnerable women and children from trafficking has been a critical cornerstone of St. Johns activities since the organization feels that trafficking is not only a heinous violation of human rights but a significant organized crime. With this guiding philosophy, the organization first made its foray in the social sector of Anti-trafficking and safe Migration in the year 2005 with the support of Sanlaap. The project Sanjog - I was implemented in chosen three Gram Panchayats under Raiganj sub-division. St. John Ambulance Association is working on anti trafficking for last four years to establish child rights. This work is implemented through sanitization and capacity building of the adolescent peer group, women self help groups and local self government. Now few cases of trafficking also are managed with the help of District Administration. Therefore, we have experiences on involvement of community and government mechanism with our activities. These working experiences on prevention of child trafficking & exploitation will supportive to implement the proposed plan to establish the right to protection among the vulnerable community. In all the blocks of Uttar Dinajpur district various projects are in action where 130 paid staffs are working. Besides these paid workers we have hundreds of dedicated volunteers throughout the district. Our organization has own vehicles (2) which is used project purpose as per need and Organization have three permanent well equipped residential training centres. By virtue of post District Magistrate is the President of our Organization. Two membership of the district JJB and DCPS and One membership of CWC represented from our Organization

ngoList.title: ST JOHN AMBULANCE ASSOCIATION RANAGHAT CENTRE
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The association started functioning with effect from 16/02/1979 as a duly authorised organisation of St. john Ambulance Association New Delhi. It has been providing services to the masses since its inception. The Association is running a Nursing home of 20 bed capacity for the treatment of eye ailments beside running a OPD centre for eye check-up. During the past 40 years the association has done nearly 25000 free and approximately 5000 paid eye operations. More than 120000 cases of eye ailments have been treated in the OPD of the centre. The Association has also been providing training to students under the different courses like First-Aid, Mother Craft and Child welfare, Hygiene & sanitation as well as Home Nursing. The number of such students is more than 50000. Our trainees are serving in various nursing homes in the states. Ambulance services was operative in the recent past. Services of Mobile Medical Vans and supply of Milk to the infants and pregnant mothers were also operative in the past but those services have been discontinued due to lack of funds. The association got it registered with the Registrar of Firms, Societies & Non trading Corporation of West Bengal on 19/04/2013. The Association has been extending financial assistance to the students of 23 Schools of Ranaghat since 2010. A sum of Rs. 2289058/- has been disbursed to 650 students till date. Coaching classes for the meritorious and financially backward students have been started from the month of Jan 2017. Need based first-aid camps are established by the association at various points in Ranaghat at various melas & sports grounds and also during Dugapaja and other festivals.

The major activities of State Resource Centre as follows: (i)Preparing Teaching Learning and training materials for non and neo literates and for literacy functionaries respectively. (ii)Training, orientation to the functionaries. (iii) Conducting Research, Evaluative study on the relevant issues. (iv) Conducting monitoring to assess the progress of the programme. (v) Conducting Innovative Activities at micro level. State Resource Centre, West Bengal received UNESCO, NLM award in 2006 and Saakshar Bharat National Literacy Award in 2015 as best supporting organisation.
